cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 200 miles SSE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the north-central Gulf, aiming for the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast tonight before turning north inland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX/LA border between Port Arthur, TX and Cameron, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs, MS (including Lake Borgne, Pontchartrain & Maurepas)
weather_observation.warning_coast: East of Intracoastal City, LA to the Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast to south-central and southeast Louisiana; surge impacts extend east to Mississippi coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) likely this afternoon through early Thursday; stronger gusts possible in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–7 ft of inundation possible near and east of the Mississippi River mouth, including lower Plaquemines Parish.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain expected; localized higher totals possible in outer rain bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; dangerous rip currents and rough seas along approaches and anchorages.
